TextBody:
Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you from our R&D team.

The difference between the third mac (where the Git blocking doesn't work) and the other two is that on the third mac the user uses the Git application provided by the "Homebrew" package manager for macOS.  This Git is an unsigned application. The EPP network extension is not able to get the process names / identifiers for unsigned applications and this is a limitation.

As a workaround you can ensure that Git is installed from a signed software package such as Xcode.  We will investigate if there is something we can do in the network extension to be able to identify unsigned processes and then notify you if we find a solution.

Kind regards
__________________
André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

I’m doing well and thanks. I hope you are also doing well.

 

Initially, I checked on 2 Mac and it worked fine as expected. 

 

Today, I tested with another Mac and observed the same issue we noticed during the call (Turning off the Intercept VPN is blocking the GitHub). Tried multiple times on the same Mac, unfortunately, the issue persists.

 

Furthermore, I have collected logs from that Mac host and uploaded them to the support portal for your reference.

 

[Inline image name : image008.png]

 

Kindly look into it and let us know. 

 

Thanks!

Dear Naveen,

Our R&D team have prepared a new test build "EPPMac3.0.4.0035", could you please download and install this build and retest the scenario for the GitHub use case.

Please use the following link to download the test build:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/Epp28022025/EPPMac3.0.4.0035.Notarized.tar

This build "EPPMac3.0.4.0035" contains a fix for the issue that was happening when the "Intercept VPN Traffic" was set to on.

Important Note:
This test build is not meant for deployment in production environment.  It is meant to be tested on 2-3 endpoints only for the purpose to validate if the fix resolves the reported issue within your environment.

Kind regards

During testing, we found that the policy functioned correctly after disabling the Intercept VPN option. 

 

In the past, your support team has suggested enabling the “Intercept VPN Option” when we had issues uploading files on MS Teams. Hence, we are hesitant to disable this setting, as we are concerned it may lead to new issues.

 

We would like to request that you test this in your environment and provide us with your feedback. Post that we will implement any changes based on your suggestions.

 

Thank you!

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

 

Hi Naveen,

I have received feedback from our developer assigned to this case.

Unchecking the "GitHub Client" from the list of applications will solve this issue. It is either the setting change did not reach the EPP agent or, if you're using multiple CAP policies, you need to make sure to uncheck the "GitHub Client" from all policies assigned to the user or computer.
To continue they please send new logs including the "reprovision.db" and "option.ini" files so we can confirm that the "GitHub Client" application name is still received from the server.

I will propose that we have another remote session with one of our developers joining in, please let  me know your available hours for tomorrow and Wednesday.

Kind regards
__________________

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

 

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you that our R&D team provided on this case.

On macOS, to achieve the requirement to block a domain while allowing another, the customer should uncheck the "GitHub Client" application from the Content Aware Protection policy.
The explanation for the experienced behavior is that the "GitHub Client" application is not controlled using Deep Packet Inspection, and on macOS the process names associated with the "GitHub Client" app include also the process names of the Git command line tools.

Can we ask you to uncheck the "Github Client" from the CAP exit points and then retest the scenario on macOS and let us know the outcome please?

Kind regards
__________________

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you from our R&D team.

The difference between the third mac (where the Git blocking doesn't work) and the other two is that on the third mac the user uses the Git application provided by the "Homebrew" package manager for macOS.  This Git is an unsigned application. The EPP network extension is not able to get the process names / identifiers for unsigned applications and this is a limitation.

As a workaround you can ensure that Git is installed from a signed software package such as Xcode.  We will investigate if there is something we can do in the network extension to be able to identify unsigned processes and then notify you if we find a solution.


Kind regards
__________________

Hi Naveen,

I have received feedback from our developer assigned to this case.

Unchecking the "GitHub Client" from the list of applications will solve this issue. It is either the setting change did not reach the EPP agent or, if you're using multiple CAP policies, you need to make sure to uncheck the "GitHub Client" from all policies assigned to the user or computer.
To continue they please send new logs including the "reprovision.db" and "option.ini" files so we can confirm that the "GitHub Client" application name is still received from the server.

I will propose that we have another remote session with one of our developers joining in, please let  me know your available hours for tomorrow and Wednesday.


Kind regards

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you that our R&D team provided on this case.

On macOS, to achieve the requirement to block a domain while allowing another, the customer should uncheck the "GitHub Client" application from the Content Aware Protection policy.
The explanation for the experienced behavior is that the "GitHub Client" application is not controlled using Deep Packet Inspection, and on macOS the process names associated with the "GitHub Client" app include also the process names of the Git command line tools.

Can we ask you to uncheck the "Github Client" from the CAP exit points and then retest the scenario on macOS and let us know the outcome please?


Kind regards

TextBody:
Hi Naveen,

Thank you for your feedback.  I have also received additional feedback from our R&D team and would like to relay to you their feedback.

The discovered bug in this case with our network extension in which it couldn't identify unsigned applications run from non-standard locations is fixed the test build "EPPMac3.0.4.0038.Notarized".  You can download this test build by following the below link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/Epp12032025/EPPMac3.0.4.0038.Notarized.tar

Can we ask you to please uninstall the existing client and install this build, retest the scenario on the 3rd mac and provide us your feedback?

Important Note:
This test build is not meant for deployment in production environment.  It is meant to be tested on 2-3 endpoints only for the purpose to validate if the fix resolves the reported issue within your environment.

Kind regards
__________________
André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

We will be awaiting your response.

 

Thanks!

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

 

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you from our R&D team.

The difference between the third mac (where the Git blocking doesn't work) and the other two is that on the third mac the user uses the Git application provided by the "Homebrew" package manager for macOS.  This Git is an unsigned application. The EPP network extension is not able to get the process names / identifiers for unsigned applications and this is a limitation.

As a workaround you can ensure that Git is installed from a signed software package such as Xcode.  We will investigate if there is something we can do in the network extension to be able to identify unsigned processes and then notify you if we find a solution.

Kind regards
__________________
André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer

Cc: cristina.moldovan-cordis@netwrix.com; Navneet Sinha <navneet.sinha@avrioc.com>; jafar@gulfitd.com; james.seaton@netwrix.com; alexandra.bolfa@netwrix.com; Avrioc IT Security <it.security@avrioc.com>; Jithin Kanhirapuzhayil <jithin.k@avrioc.com>; stefania.oltean@netwrix.com; natalia.ticu@netwrix.com; aakif@gulfitd.com; neema@gulfitd.com; Shashank Sinha <shashank.sinha@avrioc.com>

Dear Naveen,

Our R&D team have prepared a new test build "EPPMac3.0.4.0035", could you please download and install this build and retest the scenario for the GitHub use case.

Please use the following link to download the test build:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/Epp28022025/EPPMac3.0.4.0035.Notarized.tar

This build "EPPMac3.0.4.0035" contains a fix for the issue that was happening when the "Intercept VPN Traffic" was set to on.

I have received feedback from our developer assigned to this case.

Unchecking the "GitHub Client" from the list of applications will solve this issue. It is either the setting change did not reach the EPP agent or, if you're using multiple CAP policies, you need to make sure to uncheck the "GitHub Client" from all policies assigned to the user or computer.
To continue they please send new logs including the "reprovision.db" and "option.ini" files so we can confirm that the "GitHub Client" application name is still received from the server.

I will propose that we have another remote session with one of our developers joining in, please let  me know your available hours for tomorrow and Wednesday.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

 

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you that our R&D team provided on this case.

On macOS, to achieve the requirement to block a domain while allowing another, the customer should uncheck the "GitHub Client" application from the Content Aware Protection policy.
The explanation for the experienced behavior is that the "GitHub Client" application is not controlled using Deep Packet Inspection, and on macOS the process names associated with the "GitHub Client" app include also the process names of the Git command line tools.

Can we ask you to uncheck the "Github Client" from the CAP exit points and then retest the scenario on macOS and let us know the outcome please?

Kind regards
__________________

Hi Naveen,

Thank you for your feedback.  I have also received additional feedback from our R&D team and would like to relay to you their feedback.

The discovered bug in this case with our network extension in which it couldn't identify unsigned applications run from non-standard locations is fixed the test build "EPPMac3.0.4.0038.Notarized".  You can download this test build by following the below link:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/Epp12032025/EPPMac3.0.4.0038.Notarized.tar

Can we ask you to please uninstall the existing client and install this build, retest the scenario on the 3rd mac and provide us your feedback?

Important Note:
This test build is not meant for deployment in production environment.  It is meant to be tested on 2-3 endpoints only for the purpose to validate if the fix resolves the reported issue within your environment.


Kind regards

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you from our R&D team.

The difference between the third mac (where the Git blocking doesn't work) and the other two is that on the third mac the user uses the Git application provided by the "Homebrew" package manager for macOS.  This Git is an unsigned application. The EPP network extension is not able to get the process names / identifiers for unsigned applications and this is a limitation.

As a workaround you can ensure that Git is installed from a signed software package such as Xcode.  We will investigate if there is something we can do in the network extension to be able to identify unsigned processes and then notify you if we find a solution.


Kind regards
__________________
André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

Hi Naveen,

I have received feedback from our developer assigned to this case.

Unchecking the "GitHub Client" from the list of applications will solve this issue. It is either the setting change did not reach the EPP agent or, if you're using multiple CAP policies, you need to make sure to uncheck the "GitHub Client" from all policies assigned to the user or computer.
To continue they please send new logs including the "reprovision.db" and "option.ini" files so we can confirm that the "GitHub Client" application name is still received from the server.

I will propose that we have another remote session with one of our developers joining in, please let  me know your available hours for tomorrow and Wednesday.


Kind regards

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you that our R&D team provided on this case.

On macOS, to achieve the requirement to block a domain while allowing another, the customer should uncheck the "GitHub Client" application from the Content Aware Protection policy.
The explanation for the experienced behavior is that the "GitHub Client" application is not controlled using Deep Packet Inspection, and on macOS the process names associated with the "GitHub Client" app include also the process names of the Git command line tools.

Can we ask you to uncheck the "Github Client" from the CAP exit points and then retest the scenario on macOS and let us know the outcome please?


Kind regards
__________________

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

 

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you from our R&D team.

The difference between the third mac (where the Git blocking doesn't work) and the other two is that on the third mac the user uses the Git application provided by the "Homebrew" package manager for macOS.  This Git is an unsigned application. The EPP network extension is not able to get the process names / identifiers for unsigned applications and this is a limitation.

As a workaround you can ensure that Git is installed from a signed software package such as Xcode.  We will investigate if there is something we can do in the network extension to be able to identify unsigned processes and then notify you if we find a solution.

Kind regards
__________________
André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer

I will propose that we have another remote session with one of our developers joining in, please let  me know your available hours for tomorrow and Wednesday.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

 

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you that our R&D team provided on this case.

On macOS, to achieve the requirement to block a domain while allowing another, the customer should uncheck the "GitHub Client" application from the Content Aware Protection policy.
The explanation for the experienced behavior is that the "GitHub Client" application is not controlled using Deep Packet Inspection, and on macOS the process names associated with the "GitHub Client" app include also the process names of the Git command line tools.

Can we ask you to uncheck the "Github Client" from the CAP exit points and then retest the scenario on macOS and let us know the outcome please?

Kind regards
__________________

TextBody:
Hi Naveen,

Thank you for testing the build and providing us your valuable feedback.  The test build 3.0.4.0038 contained a bug that only showed up within your environment and because of your help in testing we were able to fix it. We prepared a new test build that should work in this case with the "Intercept VPN Traffic" setting.

Please use the following link to download the test build "EPPMac v3.0.5.0002":
https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/Epp19032025/EPPMac3.0.5.0002.Notarized.tar

Important Note:
This test build is not meant for deployment in production environment.  It is meant to be tested on 2-3 endpoints only for the purpose to validate if the fix resolves the reported issue within your environment.

Kind regards
__________________

To: Naveen Kumar <naveen.kumar@avrioc.com>
Cc: cristina.moldovan-cordis@netwrix.com; Navneet Sinha <navneet.sinha@avrioc.com>; jafar@gulfitd.com; james.seaton@netwrix.com; alexandra.bolfa@netwrix.com; Avrioc IT Security <it.security@avrioc.com>; Jithin Kanhirapuzhayil <jithin.k@avrioc.com>; stefania.oltean@netwrix.com; natalia.ticu@netwrix.com; aakif@gulfitd.com; neema@gulfitd.com; Shashank Sinha <shashank.sinha@avrioc.com>
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

 

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you from our R&D team.

The difference between the third mac (where the Git blocking doesn't work) and the other two is that on the third mac the user uses the Git application provided by the "Homebrew" package manager for macOS.  This Git is an unsigned application. The EPP network extension is not able to get the process names / identifiers for unsigned applications and this is a limitation.

As a workaround you can ensure that Git is installed from a signed software package such as Xcode.  We will investigate if there is something we can do in the network extension to be able to identify unsigned processes and then notify you if we find a solution.

Kind regards
__________________

Hi Naveen,

I have received feedback from our developer assigned to this case.

Unchecking the "GitHub Client" from the list of applications will solve this issue. It is either the setting change did not reach the EPP agent or, if you're using multiple CAP policies, you need to make sure to uncheck the "GitHub Client" from all policies assigned to the user or computer.
To continue they please send new logs including the "reprovision.db" and "option.ini" files so we can confirm that the "GitHub Client" application name is still received from the server.

I will propose that we have another remote session with one of our developers joining in, please let  me know your available hours for tomorrow and Wednesday.

Kind regards

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you that our R&D team provided on this case.

On macOS, to achieve the requirement to block a domain while allowing another, the customer should uncheck the "GitHub Client" application from the Content Aware Protection policy.
The explanation for the experienced behavior is that the "GitHub Client" application is not controlled using Deep Packet Inspection, and on macOS the process names associated with the "GitHub Client" app include also the process names of the Git command line tools.

Can we ask you to uncheck the "Github Client" from the CAP exit points and then retest the scenario on macOS and let us know the outcome please?

Kind regards

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you from our R&D team.

The difference between the third mac (where the Git blocking doesn't work) and the other two is that on the third mac the user uses the Git application provided by the "Homebrew" package manager for macOS.  This Git is an unsigned application. The EPP network extension is not able to get the process names / identifiers for unsigned applications and this is a limitation.

As a workaround you can ensure that Git is installed from a signed software package such as Xcode.  We will investigate if there is something we can do in the network extension to be able to identify unsigned processes and then notify you if we find a solution.


Kind regards
__________________
André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer

Hi Naveen,

I have received feedback from our developer assigned to this case.

Unchecking the "GitHub Client" from the list of applications will solve this issue. It is either the setting change did not reach the EPP agent or, if you're using multiple CAP policies, you need to make sure to uncheck the "GitHub Client" from all policies assigned to the user or computer.
To continue they please send new logs including the "reprovision.db" and "option.ini" files so we can confirm that the "GitHub Client" application name is still received from the server.

I will propose that we have another remote session with one of our developers joining in, please let  me know your available hours for tomorrow and Wednesday.


Kind regards

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you that our R&D team provided on this case.

On macOS, to achieve the requirement to block a domain while allowing another, the customer should uncheck the "GitHub Client" application from the Content Aware Protection policy.
The explanation for the experienced behavior is that the "GitHub Client" application is not controlled using Deep Packet Inspection, and on macOS the process names associated with the "GitHub Client" app include also the process names of the Git command line tools.

Can we ask you to uncheck the "Github Client" from the CAP exit points and then retest the scenario on macOS and let us know the outcome please?


Kind regards

Cc: cristina.moldovan-cordis@netwrix.com; Navneet Sinha <navneet.sinha@avrioc.com>; jafar@gulfitd.com; james.seaton@netwrix.com; alexandra.bolfa@netwrix.com; Avrioc IT Security <it.security@avrioc.com>; Jithin Kanhirapuzhayil <jithin.k@avrioc.com>; stefania.oltean@netwrix.com; natalia.ticu@netwrix.com; aakif@gulfitd.com; neema@gulfitd.com; Shashank Sinha <shashank.sinha@avrioc.com>
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

 

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you from our R&D team.

The difference between the third mac (where the Git blocking doesn't work) and the other two is that on the third mac the user uses the Git application provided by the "Homebrew" package manager for macOS.  This Git is an unsigned application. The EPP network extension is not able to get the process names / identifiers for unsigned applications and this is a limitation.

As a workaround you can ensure that Git is installed from a signed software package such as Xcode.  We will investigate if there is something we can do in the network extension to be able to identify unsigned processes and then notify you if we find a solution.

Kind regards
__________________
André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer

Hi Naveen,

I have received feedback from our developer assigned to this case.

Unchecking the "GitHub Client" from the list of applications will solve this issue. It is either the setting change did not reach the EPP agent or, if you're using multiple CAP policies, you need to make sure to uncheck the "GitHub Client" from all policies assigned to the user or computer.
To continue they please send new logs including the "reprovision.db" and "option.ini" files so we can confirm that the "GitHub Client" application name is still received from the server.

I will propose that we have another remote session with one of our developers joining in, please let  me know your available hours for tomorrow and Wednesday.

Kind regards

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

 

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you that our R&D team provided on this case.

On macOS, to achieve the requirement to block a domain while allowing another, the customer should uncheck the "GitHub Client" application from the Content Aware Protection policy.
The explanation for the experienced behavior is that the "GitHub Client" application is not controlled using Deep Packet Inspection, and on macOS the process names associated with the "GitHub Client" app include also the process names of the Git command line tools.

Can we ask you to uncheck the "Github Client" from the CAP exit points and then retest the scenario on macOS and let us know the outcome please?

Kind regards
__________________
André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you from our R&D team.

The difference between the third mac (where the Git blocking doesn't work) and the other two is that on the third mac the user uses the Git application provided by the "Homebrew" package manager for macOS.  This Git is an unsigned application. The EPP network extension is not able to get the process names / identifiers for unsigned applications and this is a limitation.

As a workaround you can ensure that Git is installed from a signed software package such as Xcode.  We will investigate if there is something we can do in the network extension to be able to identify unsigned processes and then notify you if we find a solution.


Kind regards
__________________

Hi Naveen,

I have received feedback from our developer assigned to this case.

Unchecking the "GitHub Client" from the list of applications will solve this issue. It is either the setting change did not reach the EPP agent or, if you're using multiple CAP policies, you need to make sure to uncheck the "GitHub Client" from all policies assigned to the user or computer.
To continue they please send new logs including the "reprovision.db" and "option.ini" files so we can confirm that the "GitHub Client" application name is still received from the server.

I will propose that we have another remote session with one of our developers joining in, please let  me know your available hours for tomorrow and Wednesday.


Kind regards

To: Naveen Kumar <naveen.kumar@avrioc.com>
Cc: cristina.moldovan-cordis@netwrix.com; Navneet Sinha <navneet.sinha@avrioc.com>; jafar@gulfitd.com; james.seaton@netwrix.com; alexandra.bolfa@netwrix.com; Avrioc IT Security <it.security@avrioc.com>; Jithin Kanhirapuzhayil <jithin.k@avrioc.com>; stefania.oltean@netwrix.com; natalia.ticu@netwrix.com; aakif@gulfitd.com; neema@gulfitd.com; Shashank Sinha <shashank.sinha@avrioc.com>
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you that our R&D team provided on this case.

On macOS, to achieve the requirement to block a domain while allowing another, the customer should uncheck the "GitHub Client" application from the Content Aware Protection policy.
The explanation for the experienced behavior is that the "GitHub Client" application is not controlled using Deep Packet Inspection, and on macOS the process names associated with the "GitHub Client" app include also the process names of the Git command line tools.

Can we ask you to uncheck the "Github Client" from the CAP exit points and then retest the scenario on macOS and let us know the outcome please?


Kind regards
__________________

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

 

Hi Naveen,

I would like to relay feedback to you from our R&D team.

The difference between the third mac (where the Git blocking doesn't work) and the other two is that on the third mac the user uses the Git application provided by the "Homebrew" package manager for macOS.  This Git is an unsigned application. The EPP network extension is not able to get the process names / identifiers for unsigned applications and this is a limitation.

As a workaround you can ensure that Git is installed from a signed software package such as Xcode.  We will investigate if there is something we can do in the network extension to be able to identify unsigned processes and then notify you if we find a solution.

Kind regards
__________________
André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #428361 - - Unable to block uploads on "Github" [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Irflq:ref ]

 

Hi Naveen,

I have received feedback from our developer assigned to this case.

Unchecking the "GitHub Client" from the list of applications will solve this issue. It is either the setting change did not reach the EPP agent or, if you're using multiple CAP policies, you need to make sure to uncheck the "GitHub Client" from all policies assigned to the user or computer.
To continue they please send new logs including the "reprovision.db" and "option.ini" files so we can confirm that the "GitHub Client" application name is still received from the server.

I will propose that we have another remote session with one of our developers joining in, please let  me know your available hours for tomorrow and Wednesday.

Kind regards
